thread.title: Courthouse being named for judge who fought in World War II
thread.title_full: Courthouse being named for judge who fought in World War II - WTRF 7 News Sports Weather - Wheeling Steubenville

author: cbs8
title: Courthouse being named for judge who fought in World War II
text:
PITTSBURGH (AP) - Officials are renaming the Pittsburgh federal courthouse for a federal appeals judge who served in World War II.
The Pittsburgh Post-Gazette reports ( http://bit.ly/1KoO4v8 ) a dedication ceremony will be held Nov. 20 to name the courthouse after Joseph Weis Jr. He died last year at 91.
He was nearly killed in combat in World War II and rose to become a highly respected judge. He had been in the Third U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals since 1973 and retired when he was 90.
The courthouse library was named after him in 2010.
Information from: Pittsburgh Post-Gazette, http://www.post-gazette.com
